paragraph.heading:
Dendrobium crepidatum Lindl. & Paxton
, Paxton’s Fl. Gard. 1: 63, 1850

subSubSection.paragraph:
Homotypic synonym:
Callista crepidata (Lindl. & Paxton) Kuntze, Revis.
Gen . Pl.
2: 654, 1891.

det. P . F . Hunt [
Sep 1960
]. TENASSERIM.
Parish 66
(not located), fide Parish (1883: 194) . Also reported from
Sagaing Region by
Kress et al. (2003: 72)
and from Kayah State by Saw Lwin (2007: 248) , but we have not seen material from these areas.
Distribution:— India , the Himalayas, Bangladesh , Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina and southwestern China .

Notes:— Dickason 8284 is represented by two sheets, each with slightly different data; we treat them as separate collections. Egerod B-105 is a mixed collection. The different parts were collected at the same minor locality in Kengtung District, Shan State , but with different dates (where available), which are apparently the dates of preservation of the cultivated material. Three of the sheets cited in this paper were identified as
D. crepidatum
, whereas two others were referred to
D. dixanthum
. Details are given under the respective species.
